nomade package¶

Submodules¶

nomade.database module¶

class nomade.database.Database(connection_string)¶

Bases: object

Class responsible for dealing with simple database operations. (e.g. get migration ID, set current migration ID).

property migration_id¶

Get the current migration ID.

Returns

Return the current migration ID. Return None if no record was found.

Return type

str

class nomade.database.NomadeModel(**kwargs)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Base

Nomade model class representing the nomade table that will be stored in the database.

migration¶
nomade.database.session_scope()¶

Provide a transactional scope around a series of operations.

nomade.main module¶

nomade.migration module¶

class nomade.migration.Migration(id, name, date, down_migration=None, upgrade=None, downgrade=None)¶

Bases: object

Class responsible for dealing with Nomade migrations.

Parameters

  • id (str) – Migration unique ID.

  • name (str) – Migration name.

  • date (str) – Migration date (use the format from settings).

  • down_migration (str) – Down migration (None for the first migration).

  • upgrade (function) – Migration upgrade function.

  • downgrade (function) – Migration downgrade function.

classmethod load(location, file_name)¶

Load a migration file as a Migration object.

Parameters

  • location (str) – migration file location.

  • file_name (str) – migration file name.

Returns

Return a Migration object with the information loaded from the module.

Return type

Migration

save(settings)¶

Save a migration object as a migration file.

Parameters

settings (Settings) – Nomade project settings.

nomade.migrations module¶

class nomade.migrations.Migrations(settings)¶

Bases: object

Class responsible for loading the migrations sorted.

Parameters

settings (Settings) – A settings object with migrations location.

apply_migrations()¶

Decorator responsible for applying the migrations by calling the migration_function (upgrade or downgrade) and updating the current migration ID in the database.

downgrade(steps)¶

Downgrade migrations based on steps.

Parameters

steps (int) – the number of steps to migrate.

Yields

Migration – Yields the migration to be applied.

sort()¶

Sort the _migrations list based on the migration ID.

upgrade(steps)¶

Upgrade migrations based on steps.

Parameters

steps (int) – the number of steps to migrate.

Yields

Migration – Yields the migration to be applied.

nomade.nomad module¶

class nomade.nomad.Nomad(settings_path='pyproject.toml')¶

Bases: object

current()¶

Show the current migration.

downgrade(steps)¶

Downgrade migrations based on steps.

Parameters

steps (str) – steps may ‘tail’ or a number.

history()¶

Show a list of all migrations.

static init()¶

Init a Nomade project by creating the directories and copying the necessary files.

migrate(name)¶

Create a new Nomade migration using the Migration class.

Parameters

name (str) – A short migration name (e.g. Create user table).

stamp(migration_id)¶

Stamp a specific revision to the database.

Parameters

migration_id (str) – revision ID.

upgrade(steps)¶

Upgrade migrations based on steps.

Parameters

steps (str) – steps may ‘head’ or a number.

nomade.settings module¶

class nomade.settings.Settings¶

Bases: object

Settings class responsible for dealing with TOML files.

static load(file_path='pyproject.toml')¶

Factory method responsible for loading settings from a TOML file.

Parameters

file_path (str) – path to the TOML file.

Returns

Return a Settings object with the attributes loaded from the TOML file.

Return type

Settings

save(file_path='pyproject.toml')¶

Dump the current settings to a TOML file.

Parameters

file_path (str) – path to the TOML file.

Returns

A string containing the TOML-formatted data corresponding to current object.

Return type

str

nomade.utils.slugify(content)¶

Create a slug version of a string content.

Parameters

content (str) – string content to be slugified.

Returns

A slug version of the content.

str

nomade.utils.unique_id()¶

Generate a unique ID for the migration using 8 first digits from uuid4.

Returns

Return a string containing a unique ID.

Return type

str
